Please join us in welcoming Sarah Taylor as the Principal at Purdy Elementary!

My name is Sarah Taylor, and I am excited to begin my first year as the Principal at Purdy Elementary. I have been an educator for over 20 years, beginning my career teaching kindergarten wrap-around for Vicksburg Schools. After teaching and coaching middle school students in both Paw Paw and Comstock for over a decade, I then came to Pennfield. I have truly enjoyed being Assistant Principal at Dunlap for the past three years.

I live in Battle Creek with my husband, who is also an elementary principal in the area. In my spare time you can find me gardening, traveling, kayaking, and exploring lakes around Michigan.

I am excited to work with our littlest panthers, and am thankful for the confidence placed in me to be a part of such an important time in their education. I look forward to working with the awesome parents, teachers and staff at Purdy this year!

Please join us welcome Randy Widener to Pennfield Schools as the new Assistant Principal at the Middle School!

I have worked in education for sixteen years as a social studies teacher and wrestling coach. I also worked as an elementary assistant principal in North Carolina. An Indiana native, I received a BA from Wabash College, an MA in Teaching from Earlham College, and an MA in Educational Leadership from Eastern Carolina University.

In my teaching and professional development, I focus on developing student-teacher relationships. I have presented on this topic and also taught a teacher preparation course at Miller College. As a teacher in Union City Schools for the past seven years, I have served on leadership and PBIS committees.

I am married and have four children: John, Oliver, Lilly, and Lucy. Most of my free time is spent with my family and our new puppy, Raleigh. I like to garden, canoe, and clear trails for hiking at my in-laws'. I am excited about the upcoming year and developing relationships with the Pennfield community.

Please join us in welcoming Tony Hutchins to Pennfield Schools as the new Assistant Principal at the High School!

Hello Panther Nation! My name is Tony Hutchins and I was recently hired as the Pennfield High School Assistant Principal. I come to Pennfield with 15 years of administrative experience, including time as an Elementary, Middle School, and High School Principal. Most recently, I served as a Behavior Interventionist Specialist with Leslie Public Schools. I live in Albion with wife Kathy who is a Speech Pathologist with the Calhoun ISD. Together we raised three great kids, Joey, 23, Rocky, 21 and Jacey, 17. Rocky will be a Senior at Ferris State, and Jacey will be Senior at Concord High School this year. In my spare time, I enjoy golfing, coaching, and am a huge sports fan. I am excited to meet all of the students and staff in the coming months, and look forward to helping them excel and REACH their potential. I am grateful for this opportunity to develop lasting memories for our students, and honored to be part of a great Panther Nation!

Thank you for your patience and understanding during this investigation.

Kevin Simmons
